section.title: Features added and issues fixed in version 4.1.1

listitem.para: JBDS-1806: Validation within the BPEL editor would not show malformed XML and unknown extensions as errors. This would cause code to fail without prior warning. In this release these issues are correctly flagged as validation errors in the BPEL editor, allowing for prior warning before publishing the code.

JBIDE-3727: When editing the name of a node in source view (and more than one node is present), performing backspace or delete actions would not work correctly, missing characters and when typing a new name it would appear backwards. These issues have been corrected in this release by using the org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display class and updating semantic element variables to be final. The results from editing node names is now as expected.

JBIDE-9103: When creating a JSF portlet project on a 64bit operating system, the Installing JSF Facet process would hang and project creation would fail. This issue has been corrected by modifying the AbstractLibraryProviderInstallOperationConfig.java file by implementing a facet project listener and corecting an error of an extra bracket in a section of code.

JBIDE-9013: An issue existed that would not allow the Seam Portlet example to be deployed to JBoss Enterprise Portal Platform (EPP) 4.3. The problem was caused by a change in how Web Tools Platform (WTP) deployment is undertaken. Where this used to be done through the Java build path, WTP now deploys source folders based on the WTP component.xml file. The example has now been updated to support this change.

JBDS-1818: Drools libraries were upgraded in Enterprise Application Platform 5.1.1 and the Seam tooling did not take this into account. As a result, the Seam Project wizard needed to be updated to replace the JAR core.jar to be ecj.jar in the project classpath. This update has been applied in this release and allows the Seam Project wizard to use Drools libraries correctly.

JBIDE-9516: When creating a Sample RESTful Web Service, the wizard referenced a JAR file that did not exist and an error would occur. The issue has been fixed by ensuring that the wizard looks for a file that has a name starting with jaxrs-api and ends with .jar. This also allows for the JBoss Developer Studio to automatically use newer versions of the the file in the future.

listitem.para: JBIDE-9514: Project Example ZIP files that contian empty folders, would not be imported correctly and the empty folders would be excluded, though they are necessary for the project to work (for example, the src folder). To fix this issue the NewProjectExamplesWizard.java has been modified to allow for empty folders within ZIP files to be imported correctly.

JBIDE-9381: An issue existed that meant the runtime detector did not detect the SOA 5.2 runtime correctly, instead displaying it as 5.1. Correcting this issue has seen the modification of JBossASHandler.java to also include 5.2 as a runtime displau option, and using the implementation and version properties from run.jar.

JBIDE-9361: When importing a project, if it is not faceted or does not contain a primary runtime, the project will not be imported correctly. This could have lead to errors being displayed and projects referencing an incorrect runtime. The issue has been corrected within this release by updating the WTPRuntimeFix.java by adding in code to check and handle when a project is not faceted or does not contain a primary runtime.

JBIDE-9344: When a user would import a project ZIP file using the project example framework, an empty sub-folder would appear that was unnecessary. This issue has been corrected in this release by modifying the NewProjectExamplesWizard.java file to check the files being imported and ensure the empty sub-folder no longer appears.

JBIDE-9009: The option to create a WAR archive would produce an error and the archive would not be created. The user interface menu item to auto-create a WAR archive has been removed from this release.
JBIDE-8919: A new feature has been added that allows for the ESB Runtime within the JBoss Service Oriented Architecture Platform to be separately identified and defined for individual use.

JBIDE-7052: An error existed where the optional dependency of org.hibernate.eclipse would not be resolved correctly within the BIRT component file ConsoleConfigurationOdaFactory.java. This caused any import of the plug-in to fail. The issue has been corrected by setting the org.hibernate.eclipse plug-in as reguired within the BIRT plug-ins MANIFEST.MF file.
